title: Dog day afternoon (Captioned)
creator_contributor_role: Victorian Council for Children's Films and Television, distributor
viewing_guidelines: CAPTIONED: suitable for hearing impaired viewers
subject_group: Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Gay and lesbian studies
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Homosexuality in motion pictures
description: On August 22, 1972, a ninety-seven degree day in New York City, an extraordinary robbery occured minutes before closing in a branch of the Chase Manhattan Bank. As the blistering day progressed, details about two incompetent robbers and their victims emerged. In a Borough, where the absurd is commonplace, these details developed into one of the most bizarre news stories of the year. Starring Al Pacino, John Cazale, James Broderick, Charles Durning and Chris Sarandon.
